different naming system , donT' worry about it
sda  =  hd0   sda1 = hd0,0

you need to reset grub to read stabe 1 on the boot partition which is (hd0) , hence the grub setup (hdO)

ok boot the installed version,  then run  sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg   if you don't see your card listed , use the vesa driver
what is the other card ?

if you want to install ubuntut on your comp running a ati or nvidia card you better use the alternate install cd, it is a text based installer,  install a vesa driver so you can get running and then you can install proper nvidia or ati drivers fro your card
that's pretty much all I can do for you , try the dpkg-reconfigure thing I suggested earlier
it's basicaly the same as the ubuntu live cd , but whitout the live cd part or the pretty graphics
